free\" href=\"https://projectnursery.com/2014/04/diy-tissue-paper-flowers/\">https://projectnursery.com/2014/04/diy-tissue-paper-flowers/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers#_ref-7\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.marthastewart.com/265163/pom-poms-and-luminarias-how-to\">http://www.marthastewart.com/265163/pom-poms-and-luminarias-how-to</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://liagriffith.com/tissue-paper-hydrangeas/\">https://liagriffith.com/tissue-paper-hydrangeas/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://liagriffith.com/tissue-paper-hydrangeas/\">https://liagriffith.com/tissue-paper-hydrangeas/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://liagriffith.com/tissue-paper-hydrangeas/\">https://liagriffith.com/tissue-paper-hydrangeas/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://liagriffith.com/tissue-paper-hydrangeas/\">https://liagriffith.com/tissue-paper-hydrangeas/</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 06 Mar 2022 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-6-Version-6.jpg/aid121781-v4-728px-Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-6-Version-6.jpg","linkMd5":"647eafcd3e98b699b535383b30ad82de","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn16@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-14-54-835_d0b0f24ff278707d.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":45079,"destBytes":24978,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-6-Version-6.jpg/aid121781-v4-728px-Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-6-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn16@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-14-54-835_d0b0f24ff278707d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9b/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-7-Version-6.jpg/aid121781-v4-728px-Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-7-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn41@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-15-12-815_e228abd50e882f00.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-11-Version-6.jpg/aid121781-v4-728px-Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-11-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn63@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-15-09-430_ae546bf06de2c38b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-16-Version-6.jpg/aid121781-v4-728px-Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-16-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn4@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-15-10-308_f148c7573118cb59.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-21-Version-6.jpg/aid121781-v4-728px-Make-Tissue-Paper-Flowers-Step-21-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn72@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-15-12-990_024b3a8effbed7aa.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647245693960},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","title":"How to Grill Salmon with Skin","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>For a delicious but healthy meal, grill up some salmon with the skin on. Make sure the salmon is deboned and cut up evenly before placing it on a well-oiled grill. Cook the meat side first with a sprinkle of salt to prevent it from sticking. Then cook the salmon with the skin down until it’s pink and flaky. Grilling salmon with crunchy skin isn’t complicated at all, so give it a try! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Salmon-with-Skin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Salmon-with-Skin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Cleaning and Seasoning the Salmon\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cleaning-and-Seasoning-the-Salmon\">Cleaning and Seasoning the Salmon</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Pull any pin bones out of the salmon. Lay the salmon on a cutting board skin-down. Run your fingers over the meat to feel for any small, hard lumps. Grasp the ends of the bones with needle-nose pliers or tweezers and pull them out at an angle.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Salmon with Skin Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try to pull the bones out at the angle they are pointing. Pulling them straight up will tear the fish.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cut the salmon into fillets. Use a sharp knife to divide larger pieces of salmon into fillets about wide. The pieces don’t have to be perfect, but try to keep them roughly the same size so they cook at the same rate.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Season the fish with a sprinkle of salt. Sprinkle a pinch of kosher salt evenly on each piece of salmon. The salt will prevent the fish from sticking to the grill.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Let the salmon rest for 20 minutes. Leave the salmon out so that it reaches room temperature. It’s best to do this as the grill heats. If you plan on marinating your salmon, this is also the perfect time to let the salmon rest meat-side down in the marinade.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Salmon with Skin Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could use a basic teriyaki marinade, for example, made with soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and brown sugar.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Salmon-with-Skin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Cooking the Salmon\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cooking-the-Salmon\">Cooking the Salmon</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Lightly oil the grill with a paper towel. Wad up a paper towel and pour some vegetable oil onto it. Using tongs, wipe the paper towel over the grill grate. Make sure you only apply a thin coating of oil so that the fire doesn’t flare up.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Preheat the grill to a medium high heat. A medium-high temperature equals about , if your grill has a thermometer. To test the grill later, hold your hand over it. It should feel so hot that you can only hold your hand over it for 1 second.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Salmon with Skin Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Grill the skinless side for 5 minutes. Spread the fillets on the grill skin-side up so they all cook evenly. Avoid touching the salmon until you’re ready to flip it. When the salmon is done, the meat will begin curling away from the grill.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you like the skin extra crispy, you can cook the skin side first instead.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Flip the salmon with a spatula or tongs. If the salmon sticks to the grill when you try to flip it, it most likely isn’t done, so let it cook for another minute.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Grill the skin side for 10 minutes. After about 6 minutes, the salmon will begin to appear pink in the middle, and after 10 minutes, it will be fully cooked through. Salmon that is done looks very pink and flaky. It feels firm to the touch instead of soft and spongy.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Salmon with Skin Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Depending on the grill and the thickness of the fillets, your salmon may need more time to cook.</li> \n    <li>As the salmon cooks, white foam called albumin will appear. A little bit is normal, but if your salmon is covered with it, that means it’s overcooked. Remove the salmon when you notice the white spots forming.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Move the salmon to a serving plate and let it rest for 2 minutes. Use a metal spatula to pick up the salmon and place it on a plate. No matter how delicious it looks, give it 2 minutes of resting time. The fish will continue cooking due to residual heat.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Salmon with Skin Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Salmon-with-Skin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Cutting board</li> \n  <li>Needle-nose pliers</li> \n  <li>Knife</li> \n  <li>Grill</li> \n  <li>Paper towel</li> \n  <li>Spatula</li> \n  <li>Plates</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Salmon-with-Skin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Salmon-with-Skin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/easy_grilled_salmon/\">http://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/easy_grilled_salmon/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" <li id=\"_note-4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_ref-4\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/easy_grilled_salmon/\">http://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/easy_grilled_salmon/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_ref-5\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.seriouseats.com/2010/04/how-to-clean-your-grill-barbecue-oiling-thegrate-charcoal.html\">http://www.seriouseats.com/2010/04/how-to-clean-your-grill-barbecue-oiling-thegrate-charcoal.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.foodnetwork.com/how-to/articles/how-to-grill-salmon-a-step-by-step-guide\">http://www.foodnetwork.com/how-to/articles/how-to-grill-salmon-a-step-by-step-guide</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin#_ref-7\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.foodnetwork.com/how-to/articles/how-to-grill-salmon-a-step-by-step-guide\">http://www.foodnetwork.com/how-to/articles/how-to-grill-salmon-a-step-by-step-guide</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"3b7bb86c791916de116e0fd46d9f481e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn47@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-14-54-987_9d38d08577d28897.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":57825,"destBytes":41108,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn47@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-14-54-987_9d38d08577d28897.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn8@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-15-12-391_2264ad742963d138.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn12@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-15-09-429_a1614da837d572c0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn92@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-15-13-554_4f3ee1f3054e90fc.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid9571868-v4-728px-Grill-Salmon-with-Skin-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn32@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-15-09-274_8a8f1527d9f17441.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647245693970},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","title":"How to Make Your Room Look More Grown Up","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>As you grow up, your surroundings should grow up, too. You can easily transform your room into a more mature space by making some simple tweaks to the room’s color scheme, moving and updating the furniture, and doing a little reorganization. Many modifications can be made on a tight budget, and some of them won’t even cost you a dime. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Updating Color Scheme and Design\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Updating-Color-Scheme-and-Design\">Updating Color Scheme and Design</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Choose the right color scheme. Since your color choices for the walls, bed, and curtains are going to create the main vibe of your room, stay away from pastel colors like pink and yellow. Pastels sometimes give the room a \"nursery\" atmosphere, but can work if used properly.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> Avoid colors that are very dark or neon.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 1 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Gender neutral colors to consider are purple, orange and green.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Choose contrasting colors that look trendy, youthful and really pop, like rich dark purple with yellow.</li> \n    <li>Bright red also goes great with purple, and so does black.</li> \n    <li>Stick with neutrals if you like to change your color scheme often. This makes it easier to switch your accent colors.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Work with the color scheme you have. Instead of a full color revamp, you could instead try playing off the color scheme that's there already. By updating and accenting the current color scheme, you can vastly change the appearance of your room.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-2-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 2 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-2-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, if your room currently features a lot of pastel pink, update it by adding accent colors like fuchsia, hot pink and chocolate brown.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If your room currently features a lot of pastel blue, update it by adding some royal blue accents and maybe even hunter green.</li> \n    <li>Whatever you end up going with, strive to choose colors that contrast and play off one another.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Paint an accent wall. Since you’re going darker with your color theme, paint only a single “accent” wall in your newly chosen shade. Dark paint on all four walls can make your room feel much smaller and more cramped than it is.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-3-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 3 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-3-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Streamlining in any way that makes your room look bigger and less cluttered will make it appear more adult.</li> \n    <li>If your parents are reluctant to let you paint your walls, they will be a lot more willing to allow you to paint just one.</li> \n    <li>Make sure that the paint job is done neatly so that everything looks nice and crisp.</li> \n    <li>If you don’t want to paint a wall, then try using peel and stick wall paper, a wall decal or stencil, or a tapestry to accent the wall.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add a pop culture flair.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup> As a teenager, pop culture is around you all the time and you probably have evidence of it all over your room already. Use that to your advantage! For example, if you’re really into music, collect all of your past concert ticket stubs and display them in a mountable case on the wall. Get rid of band posters unless they are nice enough to frame, then get nice frames for them.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 4 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could also use a guitar rack to neatly display your instruments, and maybe even put a keyboard somewhere in your room as a final dash of style.</li> \n    <li>Check out your garage for cool items that you can re-purpose and display in your room.</li> \n    <li>Cut out images and advertisements from magazines to accent the colors in your room in a unique way.</li> \n    <li>Display old license plates on the wall for a colorful, masculine touch.</li> \n    <li>Paint, hang, or display old surfboards, sporting equipment, and typewriters for a mature, vintage style.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Acquire some adult items. Get nice frames for anything hanging on the wall. If your walls look bare, try buying some art prints and putting them in matching frames. If you don't own a desk or bookshelf and there's enough room, get one or both of them.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-5-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 5 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-5-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Add a throw rug that matches your new color scheme. Throw rugs pull the look of a room together and look very adult.</li> \n    <li>Get a plant for your window sill. Choose something low maintenance, like a fern or potted aloe vera plant.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Arrange ore adult-like items on bookshelves, such as pictures and trinkets, and eliminate more juvenile items, such as stuffed animals and toys.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Choose a comforter and curtains with a mature pattern.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup> Get rid of the teddy bears and firetrucks and go with patterns like bold stripes, simple plaids, or tasteful polka dots.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 6 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/97/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you aren’t sure what kind of design works best, choose bedding and trimmings that are solid colors.</li> \n    <li>Add a dust ruffle to your bed that matches your new color scheme, which will hide any storage and clutter you might have underneath it.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Modifying the Layout\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Modifying-the-Layout\">Modifying the Layout</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Move or revamp the less mature furniture. For instance, if you have a very childish looking dresser, position it somewhere in the room that hides or deemphasizes it. Consider revamping childish furniture, as well. A new coat of paint in a different color can make a world of difference on even the most insignificant of items.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-7-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 7 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-7-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-7-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Always get permission before you permanently alter any furniture in your room.</li> \n    <li>If possible, try to get pieces of furniture that match each other or are part of the same set.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Create texture and layers.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup> Add vibrant accent rugs and well-constructed bean bag chairs to your floor to provide an additional pop of color and to give the space a little more texture. Stack a few bright throw pillows on your bed and nestle a few into the bean bag chairs.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-8-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 8 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-8-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-8-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Stack a few warm colored blankets on your bed in the wintertime for a cozy look.</li> \n    <li>Try hanging colored lights (like Christmas tree lights or Chinese lanterns) around a window, your bed or a bookcase. This can add a fun dimension to your room.</li> \n    <li>Fold blankets and place them into a basket for a neat way to store and display them.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make a nice desk or bookcase the focal point of the room. If you have a nice piece of furniture, such as a bookshelf or desk, move them around into the more visible areas of your room. Clean up and organize your desk or bookcase so that it looks its very best. This will give your room a much more mature vibe.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-9-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 9 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-9-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-9-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure to declutter the dresser and bookshelf and only display your nicest items on it to make it seem more grown up.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Reposition your bed. While it usually depends on the size of your room, your bed is probably the current focal point.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup> The traditional place for a bed is on the wall opposite the door, so this would be the most mature looking choice.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup> If you have a nice bed frame and headboard but your bed can't be seen from the door, move it so that it becomes the focal point.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-10-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 10 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-10-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-10-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you aren't sure, go with the arrangement that makes your room look the least cluttered. Open spaces are streamlined and more adult-looking than a cramped room.</li> \n    <li>If at all possible, don’t put your headboard against the same wall as your bedroom door, since this can have a disorienting effect on anyone who enters.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Organizing and Maintaining the Room\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Organizing-and-Maintaining-the-Room\">Organizing and Maintaining the Room</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Move or remove your stuffed animal collection. Put your stuffed animals out of sight in your closet, gift them to a younger sibling or store them in the attic. The last thing a mature-looking bedroom would ever have is a pile of plush dolls on the bed or lined up on the window sill.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-11-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 11 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-11-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-11-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Also remove any dolls and put visible toys out of sight. Store them in your closet or give them away. The same goes for childish books.</li> \n    <li>In order to make your room look more grown up, you have to be willing to put away some of your favorite childhood things.</li> \n    <li>However, you don't have to get rid of everything! Keep a favorite item out and store the rest away.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Eliminate extra clutter. If you have too many chairs, too many photos on the wall, or too many clothes bursting out of your closet, sort through them and get rid of some things. Consider donating the items that are in good condition to a local shelter or Goodwill.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-12-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 12 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-12-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-12-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Simplifying and organizing your room will lend it a sleeker, more mature vibe.</li> \n    <li>Use brightly colored storage boxes to organize your loose items. You can organize your room and add a pop of additional color at the same time.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Tidy your closet. Hang up all of your clothes neatly instead of leaving them in a pile on the floor. Get a hamper (bonus points for getting one that matches your room’s color scheme) and always put your dirty clothes in it. Keep the hamper in your closet unless you’re doing laundry.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-13-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 13 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-13-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-13-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sort through your closet and get rid of any clothing and items that you’ve outgrown.</li> \n    <li>Get a new set of clothes hangers that are sturdy and identical. Get rid of any mismatched or broken hangers.</li> \n    <li>If you want to go a step further, organize your clothing on the rack by color or by function.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Vacuum and dust at least once a week. Keep everything clean and put away any loose items on the floor. Store your backpack, school items and sporting equipment in the closet and vacuum in there as well. Remove any loose trash and empty your trash can.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Keeping your room tidy definitely gives your bedroom a much more mature vibe.</li> \n    <li>You may also want to get a nice looking hamper to throw dirty laundry into so you will not be tempted to throw it onto the floor.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make your bed every day. Incorporate this into your daily routine and do it every morning. It's a simple act, but also a very adult one. Making your bed will instantly give your room an orderly and more mature atmosphere.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Room Look More Grown Up Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you've moved your bed to be the focal point of the room, making it every day is a must.</li> \n    <li>You may also want to arrange a few throw pillows and blankets on the bed to make it look appealing. This may even help you to feel less stressed when you enter the room.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-1-Version-4.jpg","linkMd5":"549c5259bc919434f74d653cd2977438","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn6@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-14-54-963_7a2c614308050278.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":37298,"destBytes":21940,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-1-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn6@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-14-54-963_7a2c614308050278.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-2-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn72@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-15-11-996_b74443a417d8eaba.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-3-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn5@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-15-09-197_5fb22390b1d536de.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-4-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn38@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-15-09-873_473fd9414f209d41.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-5-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn24@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-15-28-453_f759794333e1fe33.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/97/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-6-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn25@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-15-12-149_298d7022c45e2e23.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-7-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-7-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn22@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-15-12-303_4f9e6ba8bc521283.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-8-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-8-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-15-13-397_adbbf4f224e249c6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-9-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-9-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn76@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-15-13-099_8b896d3a08ec2ee7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-10-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-10-Version-4.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-11-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-11-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn68@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-15-09-656_fc263c0f0b10c063.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-12-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-12-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn60@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-15-09-266_5a157122d19fcd07.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-13-Version-4.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-13-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn57@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-15-29-728_0e19dec617023d4b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn68@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-15-11-234_8898cc6ad360475f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid3837408-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-Look-More-Grown-Up-Step-15-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn39@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-15-13-247_c03890e4f097b8a0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647245693963},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","title":"How to Hold a Door Open with a Coin","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p> Doors that shut on their own are designed that way for a reason. They can be built to <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-a-House-Fire\" title=\"Prevent a House Fire\">prevent the spread of fire</a> and smoke in a building and also keep the bugs and insects away from the cool refreshing air.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> You may need to hold the door open temporarily. Placing a coin in a door will not hold it open wide enough to walk in and out of the door. However, it will prevent the door from closing all the way. If you're moving small furniture in and out of your home during moving, this can be helpful. It eliminates the need to unlock the door or turn the knob each time, as you can merely push against the door to get it to swing open. If you need to prop a door open wider, use a door stop or a heavy object instead of a coin. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Placing a Coin in the Door Hinge\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Placing-a-Coin-in-the-Door-Hinge\">Placing a Coin in the Door Hinge</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Grab a coin. Canadian/US Quarter or 20/50 Euro Cents work well. Avoid using small coins like pennies or dimes as they do not have enough surface area to hold the door open. You may need more than one coin if you're unable to jam the door open with a single coin.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're in another country like Australia or South Korea, use the largest and thickest coin possible.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Open the door slightly. To start, open the door slightly. Open it just enough that you can fit a coin between the edge of the door near the hinges and the door frame. You may want to have someone hold the door open for you. It can be difficult to hold the door open on your own, and you do not want to prop the door open with another object. If the door is propped open too wide, it may be difficult to properly insert the coin.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Insert the coin into the upper hinge. To start, you'll want to insert one coin in the door's upper hinge. Take your coin and position it just below the top hinge of the door.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dd/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Place the coin between the edge of the door and the door frame. About half the coin should be between the door and frame.</li> \n    <li>Move the coin upward slightly and push it into the door's hinge. Let the door close. With luck, the door should be propped open just slightly to the point you can push the door open without during the handle.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Secure the coin with tape, if necessary. If your door's hinge is wider, the coin may slip out. Therefore, you may need to secure coin in the door frame with a piece of tape. Go for masking tape or duct tape over scotch tape, as these types of tape tend to be stronger. Push the coin back between the door and door frame, and slide it into the hinge. Once the coin's in place, tape it down with a strip of tape.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Try a coin in the lower hinge if this does not work. Depending on the build of your door, this method may not work. If you're unsuccessful, you can try securing a coin in the bottom hinge as well. Follow the same method as you did when placing a coin in the top hinge. If this still does not work, you should try another method. No method will work on every type of door. \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Taping a Coin Over the Strike Plate\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Taping-a-Coin-Over-the-Strike-Plate\">Taping a Coin Over the Strike Plate</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Identify the strike plate. You can also hold a door open with a coin using the door's striker plate. First, identify the strike plate on your door. The strike plate is the metal part of your door affixed to the door jamb. It is found on the side of the door, near the doorknob. The strike plate usually has bolts installed to hold it to the edge of your door. It's main purpose is to prevent friction as the door opens and closes. If you place coins over the striker plate, they may prevent the door from swinging closed.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tape a coin over the door's strike plate. Take your coin and place it somewhere on the strike plate. It does not matter where you place coin. Just make sure the coin is somewhere on the metallic strike plate. Use thick tape, like masking tape or duct tape.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You may want to place the coin over the door's latch. This can hold the door handle at an open angle, allowing you to push the door open and closed without turning the knob. This will also prevent the door from locking.</li> \n    <li>However, placing the coin on the door latch may not hold the door open. Depending on the gap between your door and door frame, it may just allow you to push the door open and closed.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add more coins to the striker plate if you're unsuccessful. One coin may not be enough to successfully hold your door open. If there's a larger gap between your door and door frame, a single coin may not be thick enough. If one coin does not work, tape another over the first coin. You may have to add quite a few coins before your door is successfully propped open with coins. \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Taking Safety Precautions\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Taking-Safety-Precautions\">Taking Safety Precautions</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Do not prop a door open around children. You want to be careful when propping doors open if you live with young children. A door could swing open and closed fast if a child fell or pushed on it. This could cause injury. If you need to prop a door open, do so only when your children are secured elsewhere.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Make sure animals will not get out if a door is propped open. If you have pets, do not leave a door propped open unless you're supervising them. A larger dog could push a propped door open and get loose. Make sure to secure animals in another room before propping a door open with a coin.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Use a conventional door stop or bigger objects on a larger door. A heavier door will be unlikely to be propped open by a coin. The force of a heavy door can easily dislodge a coin doorstop, even one that is carefully taped down. If you need to hold open a larger door, use a bigger object like a chair or cinderblock. You can also purchase a door stop at a local hardware store.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Hold a Door Open with a Coin Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid68477-v4-728px-Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>A golf ball can be used to hold open some larger doors.</li> \n  <li>If you find a door wedge or stopper, use that instead.</li> \n  <li>Instead of a coin, have a friend hold the door open for you.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>As convenient as this may be, it could be unsafe and/or illegal to prop open a fire door or one which automatically locks when it closes. Doing so could jeopardize yours and others' safety.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Hold-a-Door-Open-with-a-Coin&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Open-a-Door-with-a-Credit-Card\" title=\"Open a Door with a Credit Card\">Open a Door with a Credit Card</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Unstick-a-Door\" title=\"Unstick a Door\">Unstick a Door</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Kick-Down-a-Door\" title=\"Kick Down a Door\">Kick Down a Door</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Hang-a-Door\" title=\"Hang a Door\">Hang a Door</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-an-Interior-Doorknob\" title=\"Replace an Interior Doorknob\">Replace an Interior Doorknob</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\"
