/08-15-10-928_2f481cb310cbbf8e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid666682-v4-728px-Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn39@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-15-09-712_0ee36a0c72e66a20.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid666682-v4-728px-Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn65@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-15-13-022_ab5d0051156485c3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid666682-v4-728px-Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn77@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-15-13-971_2d4993e885c5f237.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid666682-v4-728px-Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn29@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-15-09-228_96515812b9e2a747.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid666682-v4-728px-Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn67@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-15-13-523_9f8d052d76efcf30.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid666682-v4-728px-Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-12-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn79@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-15-13-525_b4c4a1ad38ea94b1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid666682-v4-728px-Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn14@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-15-10-141_a27ebfe702fca966.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dc/Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid666682-v4-728px-Remove-Long-Wearing-Lipstick-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn42@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-15-09-940_aff9f36f6bac5de3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647245693970},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","title":"How to Do Digital Art on Your Phone","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>If you are an artist on the go, digital art apps let you create your next masterpiece anytime, anywhere. There are a number of digital art apps for both iPhone and Android that allow you to sketch, draw, or paint. Check out this list to find the best digital art app for your creative needs! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Procreate Pocket\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Procreate-Pocket\">Procreate Pocket</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Procreate Pocket offers all you need and more. The app is available on the Apple App Store and offers many features ranging from simple to complex. Open the Procreate Pocket app and start a new canvas by clicking the white plus sign at the top right corner of the home screen. Play around with brush styles, colors, and different elements as you make your digital artwork.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-1.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Procreate Pocket is only available on iPhone and iPod Touch, and requires iOS 13.2 or later.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Procreate Pocket offers most of the same features as the Procreate iPad app. For a more in-depth explanation of how to use these features, check out <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-Using-the-Procreate-App-on-iOS\">this article</a><sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Sketchbook\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sketchbook\">Sketchbook</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Sketchbook is a great and simple-to-use option for beginning digital doodlers. It is available on Android and iOS devices, so you can find it in either the Apple or Google Play app stores.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> After Sketchbook has been installed on your phone, enter the app and begin drawing with your finger on the screen.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-2.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can change the color, size, and opacity of your brush by tapping the color wheel and pen icons in the top menu.</li> \n    <li>Tap the icon of the protractor and the ruler to explore more Sketchbook design features.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Adobe Fresco\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Adobe-Fresco\">Adobe Fresco</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Adobe Fresco is an innovative and professional-grade drawing app. Available on iOS devices and with an Adobe account, this app offers high-quality design options. All art made on this app will sync to your Adobe cloud, making it accessible from any device. This app is ideal for advanced or professional artists.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-3.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For more information about how to use Adobe Fresco, check out <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://helpx.adobe.com/fresco/tutorials.html\">this tutorial page</a>.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: iArtbook\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"iArtbook\">iArtbook</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Design features galore! Like Procreate Pocket, this app offers phone artists everything they could possibly need. The app's tools can be tricky to understand and navigate, so beginners may consider other options. This app is available on iOS and Android devices.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-4.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>iArtbook saves your designs in a cloud that can be accessed by the computer version of the app, making it ideal for artists who work on multiple devices.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Paper by WeTransfer\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Paper-by-WeTransfer\">Paper by WeTransfer</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Paper is a versatile and beautifully designed app fit for any skill level. Paper offers a variety of features, though professional artists may benefit from the more complex and precise tools offered by Procreate Pocket or iArtbook. This app is only available on iOS devices, so you can find it in the Apple App Store. On Paper, you can organize your drawings together in sketchbooks.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-5.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Play around with the Paper Demo offered when you first open the app to learn more about how to use it.</li> \n    <li>The design controls on Paper are in a panel at the bottom of the screen.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Tayasui Sketches\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tayasui-Sketches\">Tayasui Sketches</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Tayasui Sketches is a sophisticated yet user-friendly app. It offers a decent number of features which are all relatively straightforward, making it a good option for a beginner or intermediate digital artist. Tayasui Sketches is available on Android and iOS devices, so you can find it in either the Apple or Google Play app stores.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup> Once Sketches has been installed, open the app. You will be taken to a blank canvas where you can immediately begin drawing with your finger.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-6.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Use the menu at the bottom to explore the app's design features.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Concepts\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Concepts\">Concepts</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Concepts is a free and straightforward app with very simple controls, making it ideal for beginning artists or children. Concepts is available on Android, iOS, and Samsung devices.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup> Start by going to the Apple, Google Play, or Galaxy app store on your phone. After installing Concepts, enter the app. You will automatically be taken to a blank canvas where you can begin drawing.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-7.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The design controls are at the top of the screen.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: MediBang Paint\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"MediBang-Paint\">MediBang Paint</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>MediBang Paint is a drawing app with special manga tools and comic templates. If you like drawing manga style or making comics, check out this app. MediBang Paint is more complicated to use than many of the other apps listed, so children and beginners may consider other options. This app is available on iOS and Android devices.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-8.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Check out the in-app tutorial for a more thorough rundown of how to use this app.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: FlipaClip\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"FlipaClip\">FlipaClip</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>FlipaClip is a user-friendly 2D animation app. On FlipaClip, you can easily make animation videos by drawing multiple panels to be played consecutively. If you are interested in trying out animation, this is the digital art app for you.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-9.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>FlipaClip is available on the Google Play and Apple app stores.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Happy Color\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Happy-Color\">Happy Color</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Happy Color is a relaxing paint by number coloring app. Happy Color is perfect for anyone looking for a fun, casual art app to get creative and unwind. Available on the Google Play and Apple app stores, this app offers a wide variety of designs for users to color in.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Digital Art on Your Phone Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-10.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This app does not allow for freehand drawing, so if you are looking to make your own original designs, you may want to look elsewhere.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/procreate-pocket/id916366645\">https://apps.apple.com/us/app/procreate-pocket/id916366645</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-Using-the-Procreate-App-on-iOS\">https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-Using-the-Procreate-App-on-iOS</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" href=\"https://concepts.app/en/\">https://concepts.app/en/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://medibangpaint.com/en/iphone/\">https://medibangpaint.com/en/iphone/</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 13 Mar 2022 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-1.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"41cf2aecf0a28a84035f4c89488f8f12","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn49@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-14-54-893_787b5e44d1cd3b32.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":72656,"destBytes":34764,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-1.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn49@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-14-54-893_787b5e44d1cd3b32.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-2.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-2.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-3.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn46@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-15-09-229_9e0c5cef3e1701db.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-4.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn75@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-15-11-991_14e8c274d8240f18.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-5.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn97@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-15-10-841_5ef02d33456ad9bc.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-6.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn80@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-15-11-516_1c5beb5bbf60eede.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-7.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn12@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-15-13-662_246c2856709f4f16.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-8.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn46@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-15-12-887_75a7a41967e2e147.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-9.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn42@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-15-10-234_e77733d21f71fd34.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-10.jpg/aid12914727-v4-728px-Do-Digital-Art-on-Your-Phone-Step-10.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647245693971},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:14:53","title":"How to Freeze Bacon","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>While bacon should only be refrigerated for up to seven days,<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> you can prolong the freshness of your bacon by freezing it. However, if you freeze the entire package, you’ll need to thaw and cook the entire package, too! For those times when you need a couple slices of bacon for your dinner recipe or are craving just one slice (or two… or three…) to go with your morning eggs, here are a couple methods for freezing bacon individually. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Freeze-Bacon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Freeze-Bacon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Folding Your Bacon in Wax Paper\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Folding-Your-Bacon-in-Wax-Paper\">Folding Your Bacon in Wax Paper</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Cut a long strip of wax paper. You want to have enough wax paper to spread out your entire package of bacon with a couple inches between each piece.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup> You can also use parchment paper.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Freeze-Bacon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Lay your wax paper on your counter. Be sure your counter is clean and free of crumbs.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Freeze-Bacon-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Place your bacon on the wax paper. With your fingers or tongs, place one piece of bacon on one end of the wax paper.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup> Smooth the bacon flat.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Wrap your bacon.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup> Grab the other end of the wax paper and pull it toward your bacon until it touches the edge of the slice you just laid down. Create a crease so that your bacon stays put.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Your first slice of bacon is now covered with wax paper on both sides.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add another slice of bacon. Place it directly on top of the wax paper covering the top of your first slice.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Repeat your fold.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup> Pull the end of your wax paper that is free of bacon back over the top of your second slice of bacon.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You are essentially creating an accordion fold around each slice of bacon so that they are individually wrapped.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Continue this process until all your bacon is folded into the wax paper.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Place your bacon in a freezer bag. <sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup> Place your wax paper-wrapped bacon stack in the bottom of the bag and use your arm to flatten the rest of the bag against the counter. Be sure to squeeze all the air out of the bag.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Write the date on your freezer bag so that you remember how long you have stored it.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Freeze.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup> There’s no need to deep freeze your bacon, just be sure that your freezer is set at zero degrees.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Freeze-Bacon-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Freeze-Bacon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Rolling Your Bacon Individually\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Rolling-Your-Bacon-Individually\">Rolling Your Bacon Individually</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Prepare a baking sheet. Line your baking sheet with a piece of wax paper or parchment paper. The lined baking sheet will serve as your surface for creating and freezing your bacon rolls.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Freeze-Bacon-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Create your rolls. You can lay your bacon onto your prepared baking sheet or roll your bacon as you pull it out of the package. Begin on one end of the bacon strip and roll it until the entire piece is wrapped around itself.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Place your rolls on your baking sheet. Be sure that the end of your bacon roll is on the bottom so that the bacon doesn’t uncoil. Your bacon will resemble the shape of a snail.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dd/Freeze-Bacon-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Be sure that the bacon rolls aren’t touching each other.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Freeze your bacon. Once you have completed all of your bacon rolls, place the baking sheet into your freezer.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup> Wait until the bacon is frozen solid.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Freeze-Bacon-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Put your bacon in a freezer safe bag. Once your bacon has frozen into the rolls, you can take them off the baking pan, place them in an airtight container or freezer bag, and put them back in the freezer immediately.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can now use your bacon as needed. You won’t need to pry frozen bacon off of wax paper, and the bacon strips will only be frozen to themselves (not each other).<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Freeze-Bacon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Flash Freezing Your Bacon\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Flash-Freezing-Your-Bacon\">Flash Freezing Your Bacon</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Prepare a baking sheet. This method also requires that you line your baking sheet with a piece of wax paper or parchment paper. The lined baking sheet will serve as your surface for laying out and freezing your bacon slices.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Freeze-Bacon-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Place your bacon on the baking sheet in a single layer. You don’t need to leave a lot of space between each slice, but be sure the sides of your bacon are not touching.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Add another layer. If have more bacon than fits on your baking sheet, you can add another sheet of wax paper on top of your first layer of bacon. Then you can finish spreading out your bacon on top of that second sheet of wax paper.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Freeze your bacon. Place your baking sheet in the freezer.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup> Wait until the bacon is frozen solid.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 17 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Freeze-Bacon-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Separate your bacon. Once your bacon is frozen on your baking sheet, pull off the slices of bacon from your wax paper, place them in an airtight container or freezer bag, and put them back in the freezer immediately.<br /><br /></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Freeze-Bacon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Handling Bacon Safely\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Handling-Bacon-Safely\">Handling Bacon Safely</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Grab the bacon last. At the supermarket, be sure that your bacon is the very last item you select before checking out.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup> If you pick up your bacon at the beginning of your supermarket trip, it’s potentially developing bacteria while you are checking the other items off your list.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-19-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 19 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Freeze-Bacon-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-19-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Freeze immediately. Do not use previously opened bacon that has already been stored in your fridge. Cured meats like bacon can spoil or develop bacteria at temperatures higher than 40 degrees Fahrenheit<sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup>, so be sure to prepare your bacon for individual freezing immediately after purchasing it.<sup id=\"_ref-24\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 24\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-24\">[24]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-20-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 20 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Freeze-Bacon-Step-20-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-20-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Wash your hands. While this step might seem obvious, it’s still important. Even beyond washing your hands before and after you prepare your bacon, you should also wash your hands at any point after touching the bacon and before touching any supplies.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-21-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 21 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Freeze-Bacon-Step-21-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-21-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, if you need to grab some more wax paper or a freezer bag, don’t forget to wash your hands first. Otherwise, your roll of wax paper or box of storage bags will be contaminated.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Disinfect your counter top. It’s important to disinfect both before and after you prepare your bacon for freezing. Any bacteria that is on your counter can be transferred to the wax paper and onto your bacon.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-22-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 22 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Freeze-Bacon-Step-22-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-22-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Check the date. Be sure to check the “use by” date and the number of days recommended for refrigeration, as well. While freezing keeps your bacon fresher longer, you should definitely freeze your bacon prior to the expiration date. Likewise, if you needed to store the bacon in your fridge before freezing it, be sure to freeze it before the end of the suggested refrigeration period,<sup id=\"_ref-25\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 25\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-25\">[25]</a></sup> which is seven days.<sup id=\"_ref-26\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 26\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-26\">[26]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-23-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 23 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Freeze-Bacon-Step-23-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-23-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The longer bacon is stored, the less flavorful it will be. For best quality, store your bacon in the freezer for no more than one month.<sup id=\"_ref-27\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 27\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-27\">[27]</a></sup> Three months is the recommended maximum storage time.<sup id=\"_ref-28\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 28\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-28\">[28]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use your bacon immediately after thawing it. Always thaw food in the refrigerator or in cold water. If using cold water, replace the water at 30 minute intervals. Do not thaw bacon at room temperature.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Freeze-Bacon-Step-24-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Bacon Step 24 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Freeze-Bacon-Step-24-Version-2.jpg/aid39660-v4-728px-Freeze-Bacon-Step-24-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Freeze-Bacon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>It is best to freeze unopened packages of bacon.<sup id=\"_ref-29\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 29\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-29\">[29]</a></sup> However, if you do follow one of these methods, be sure to keep your bacon frozen at 0 degrees Fahrenheit<sup id=\"_ref-30\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 30\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-30\">[30]</a></sup> and use it immediately after defrosting.</li> \n  <li>Check your bacon before cooking to make sure it hasn’t gone bad. If your bacon is slimy or has a dull color, discard it immediately.<sup id=\"_ref-31\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 31\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_note-31\">[31]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Freeze-Bacon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Wax paper or parchment paper</li> \n  <li>A baking sheet</li> \n  <li>Freezer bags or an airtight container</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Freeze-Bacon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Bacon-in-the-Microwave\" title=\"Cook Bacon in the Microwave\">Cook Bacon in the Microwave</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Bacon-Sandwich\" title=\"Make a Bacon Sandwich\">Make a Bacon Sandwich</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Bacon-and-Ham-Sandwich\" title=\"Make a Bacon and Ham Sandwich\">Make a Bacon and Ham Sandwich</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Freeze-Bacon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://nchfp.uga.edu/how/freeze/bacon.html\">http://nchfp.uga.edu/how/freeze/bacon.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://nchfp.uga.edu/how/freeze/bacon.html\">http://nchfp.uga.edu/how/freeze/bacon.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.fda.gov/Food/ResourcesForYou/Consumers/ucm253954.htm\">http://www.fda.gov/Food/ResourcesForYou/Consumers/ucm253954.htm</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-17\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" <li id=\"_note-18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-18\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" href=\"http://www.foodrenegade.com/easil-store-bacon/\">http://www.foodrenegade.com/easil-store-bacon/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.fsis.usda.gov/wps/wcm/connect/98dfaf58-75f3-4535-a0fa-589ca077cc76/Bacon_and_Food_Safety.pdf?MOD=AJPERES\">http://www.fsis.usda.gov/wps/wcm/connect/98dfaf58-75f3-4535-a0fa-589ca077cc76/Bacon_and_Food_Safety.pdf?MOD=AJPERES</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-23\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-24\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-24\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-25\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-25\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-28\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-28\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Bacon#_ref-29\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\"
